headline.main: Our City Free School System--Some Improvements Suggested.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New- York Daily Times: The legal organization of the consolidated system of Public Instruction, in this City, has been in operation since 1853, when the Public and Ward Schools were united, and it has very fairly met the expectation of its projectors. At the time it was adopted, however, there were many things to be taken into consideration that have ceased to exist.

headline.main: NEW - YORK CITY.; Lecture on Nicaragna by Ex-Consul Fa benss New-York Historical Socity--Annual Meeting. The Lady Doctors. Fires. The Icy Sidewalks. Republican Germans. Army Affairs. Dispensaries.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lady doctors are coming to be institutions among us. This is perfectly natural: the proprieties dictate the need of their practice among their own sex, and even the "regulars" are beginning to extend them the right hand of fellowship and to welcome them to the ranks of the profession. They are, in fact, but reviving an old custom, dating as far back as the days of Moses.

headline.main: The Loss of the Lyonnais.; STATEMENT OP ONE OF THE SURVIVORS--THE RESOUE OF THE THIRD MATE'S PARTY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Weser Zeitung, of Bremen, publishes a letter from Mr. GEORGE SHEDELL, one of the passengers of the lost steamship Lyonnais, who was rescued with the party in the third mate's boat; but, instead of turning to New-York by the Eliza, of Hamburg, preferred going on to Bremen in the Elize, Captain NORDENHOLT. His narrative is interesting: ON BOARD THE BREMEN SHIP ELIZE, AT SEA Sunday, Nov. 23. 1856.

headline.main: BROOKLYN COMMON COUNCIL.; Organization of tho New Board. Mayor Powell's Message.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new Board of Aldermen met yesterday afternoon and proceeded to organize. His Honor Mayor POWELL, took the Chair. When the clerk called the roll, C. R. ATWATER, Esq., demanded that his name should be called as an Alderman of the Seventh Ward.
docs.snippet: The new Board of Aldermen met yesterday afternoon and proceeded to organize. His Honor Mayor POWELL, took the Chair. When the clerk called the roll, C. R. ATWATER, Esq., demanded that his name should be called as an Alderman of the Seventh Ward.

headline.main: OUR MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT FOR 1857.; Inauguration of the New Common Council. Election of Ald. Claney to the President's Chair of the Aldermanie Board. Election of Jonas B. Philips as Chairman of the Board of Councilmen. Reappointment of David T.Valentine and C. T. McClenahan, Esqs., as Clerks. APPOINTMENT: OF MINOR OFFICERS. MESSAGE FROM THE MAYOR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new Board of Aldermen met to-day in the City Hall at 12 o'clock M. Soon afterwards, the Mayor, accompanied by Col. MING, entered the Chamber, and proceeded to swear in the new members.
docs.snippet: The new Board of Aldermen met to-day in the City Hall at 12 o'clock M. Soon afterwards, the Mayor, accompanied by Col. MING, entered the Chamber, and proceeded to swear in the new members.

headline.main: MARINE ITEMS.; Arrival of Schooner Flying Eagle, the Reported Slaver--Denial of the Captain--Abandoned Vessel Board, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The schooner Flying Eagle, of Brookhaven, L. I., which has reported seized as a slaver on the coast of Africa, arrived at this port yesterday, from Loando, West Coast of Africa, consigned to J. A. MACHADO. We lay before the public this morning the statement of Captain CONK, wholly denying the ?? of the report named.
docs.abstract: Statements respecting the Flying Eagle, denied

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Lectures. Huntingdon at Sing Sing. Liquor Dealers' Society. New-York Horticultural Society. Political.
The Arctic Ship Resolute and the American Officers at Portsmouth.; From the London Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday, after the departure of the Queen, the ship was thrown open to the inspection of all who chose to avail themselves of the opportunity of inspecting her, and about 3,000 persons of all ranks visited the ship and partook of the hospitality of Captain HARTSTEIN and his officers.
